intro: Senecio riskindii, commonly known as Riskind's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
